text: What are some good internet browsers for the phone that are not google/chromium. I have firefox but its really terrible on my android.

elements.text: What are some good internet browsers for the phone that are not google/chromium. I have firefox but its really terrible on my android.

text: I agree on Firefox: as much as I love it on desktop, I can't stand it on mobile (at least last time I tried it one or two years ago)

elements.text: I agree on Firefox: as much as I love it on desktop, I can't stand it on mobile (at least last time I tried it one or two years ago)

text:
They did an update of Firefox that puts the address bar on the bottom of the browser
Its horrible

elements.text:
They did an update of Firefox that puts the address bar on the bottom of the browser
Its horrible

text: I tried firefox for a year or two on my mobile, and it wasn't good. I'm now on brave for some time, and like it.

elements.text: I tried firefox for a year or two on my mobile, and it wasn't good. I'm now on brave for some time, and like it.

text: The reason I stopped using chromium was that it auto signs you in to your google account.

elements.text: The reason I stopped using chromium was that it auto signs you in to your google account.

text: I use brave, its chromium but less integrated with your google identity.

elements.text: I use brave, its chromium but less integrated with your google identity.

text: The old version of Firefox mobile was good. I changed back to Chrome after the latest FF update

elements.text: The old version of Firefox mobile was good. I changed back to Chrome after the latest FF update

text: Automatically signing in to the Google account is both good and bad. It can be quite convenient to access some SSO webpages using it. But yeah... tracking...

elements.text: Automatically signing in to the Google account is both good and bad. It can be quite convenient to access some SSO webpages using it. But yeah... tracking...

text: for casual browsing, I find Firefox Focus quite good (and faster than the classical Firefox app)

elements.text: for casual browsing, I find Firefox Focus quite good (and faster than the classical Firefox app)

text: I use the nightly version of Firefox on android and like it. I like the address bar at the bottom of the screen, easier to reach with my thumbs. You can move it back if you want though.

elements.text: I use the nightly version of Firefox on android and like it. I like the address bar at the bottom of the screen, easier to reach with my thumbs. You can move it back if you want though.

text: For me the biggest problem is video playback. I can only watch videos on youtube/insta/reddit once, and then the whole browsers video player crashes/stops working until i refresh the page.

elements.text: For me the biggest problem is video playback. I can only watch videos on youtube/insta/reddit once, and then the whole browsers video player crashes/stops working until i refresh the page.

text: I'm also reasonably happy with FF nightly on Android, address bar at the top though :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: I'm also reasonably happy with FF nightly on Android, address bar at the top though

text: I like the address bar on the bottom, I can actually reach it easily. I use FF on mobile mostly because it has support for extensions like ublock origin

elements.text: I like the address bar on the bottom, I can actually reach it easily. I use FF on mobile mostly because it has support for extensions like ublock origin

text: There is an option to put the browser bar back at the top

elements.text: There is an option to put the browser bar back at the top

text: I like it because it doesn't hang on websites I frequently use. But it got really annoying

elements.text: I like it because it doesn't hang on websites I frequently use. But it got really annoying

text:
CM Browser might be worth checking out, I use it in some contexts due to some of its feature, like an "extremely" fullscreen mode, which is great for some content. It also plays videos on all sites I've tried. It also has built-in (toggleable probably) popup+ad blocker which is a bonus.

Very nice fullscreen mode (the black bar on top is an artifact, it doesn't draw over the notification area at the moment for whatever reason, it usually does, might be caused by system rather than app): <https://i.imgur.com/gFkDHjW.jpg>

You can access non-fullscreen temporarily by pressing the very transparent button in the bottom right corner while in fullscreen mode to get this: <https://i.imgur.com/E2kKWSL.png>

elements.text:

Very nice fullscreen mode (the black bar on top is an artifact, it doesn't draw over the notification area at the moment for whatever reason, it usually does, might be caused by system rather than app):
You can access non-fullscreen temporarily by pressing the very transparent button in the bottom right corner while in fullscreen mode to get this:

text: Huh sorry, might need an old APK or something, seems to be several iterations of the same app out there, and they all appear to suck :confused:

text: ```Besides its ridiculously small size, it has an easy-to-use browsing interface, a high page-download speed, and an integrated malware protection system.```

text: :thumbsup:
I personally use Bromite which is a privacy-conscious Chromium based browser (with adblocking). But other than Chromium based browsers, I don't know :-(

attachments.text: The browser maker denies violating Google's Android app policies.
